key.name: format
key.description: This key specifies the hour format used by the clock applet. Possible values are "12-hour", "24-hour", "internet", "unix" and "custom". If set to "internet", the clock will display Internet time. The Internet time system divides the day into 1000 ".beats". There are no time zones in this system, so time is the same all over the world. If set to "unix", the clock will display time in seconds since Epoch, i.e. 1970-01-01. If set to "custom", the clock will display time according to the format specified in the custom_format key.

key.name: custom-format
key.description: This key specifies the format used by the clock applet when the format key is set to "custom". You can use conversion specifiers understood by strftime() to obtain a specific format. See the strftime() manual for more information.

key.name: show-seconds
key.description: If true, display seconds in time.

key.name: show-date
key.description: If true, display date in the clock, in addition to time.

key.name: show-tooltip
key.description: If true, show date in a tooltip when the pointer is over the clock.

key.name: show-weather
key.description: If true, display a weather icon.

key.name: show-temperature
key.description: If true, show the temperature next to the weather icon.

key.name: show-week-numbers
key.description: If true, show week numbers in the calendar.

key.name: expand-locations
key.description: If true, expand the list of locations in the calendar window.

key.name: cities
key.description: A list of locations to display in the calendar window.

key.name: temperature-unit
key.description: The unit to use when showing temperatures.

key.name: speed-unit
key.description: The unit to use when showing wind speed.
